title: Auspicion 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Maple and cinnamon aromas and sweet-seeming flavors come with a soft texture in this simple, entry-level wine that has an atypical personality for a Cabernet.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas NV Viura-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: Yeasty aromas are low on fruit and specifics. This Viura-Chardonnay blend is lazy in feel, with modest acidic cut. Sweet bland flavors quickly fall off and taste of powdered sugar on the finish.

title: Sonoma Collection 2015 District 3 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a rough, simple and nutty white that shows a bite of fresh pear and some barrel reduction.

title: Stable Hill 2013 The Little Villager Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: Cranberries and pie cherries give a crisp, almost citrusy, edge to this wine. The tannins are silky and there's some appealing clove-like spice as well, but the acids are elevated, making the wine come across as tart and ungenerous.

title: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Auzriel Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This spent 16 months in neutral oak, and it shows some muted scents that may be attributed to those barrels. Earthy unripe fruit, tasting mainly of apple skins, also sends up light whiffs of fish oil. Drink up.

title: Half Mile Creek 2014 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: Despite moderate alcohol, this is full-bodied and almost sweet-tasting. Hints of dairy products combine with orange and pineapple flavors on the thickly textured palate.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2014 Echo Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Astringent purple-black in hue, yet somehow not quite fully ripe, this sports a full range of herbal flavors, dried leaves, wet stems and toasted grains. There's not much in the way of fruit however, and the wine seems manipulated.

title: Wakefield 2015 Pinot Gris (Clare Valley)
description: This is a pretty lean, ungenerous version of Pinot Gris. Wet stone and citrus aromas are promising, while the medium-bodied palate delivers lime and underripe stone fruit.

title: Rodriguez Sanzo 2014 Give Me Five by Javier Rodriguez  (Rioja)
description: Charred chocolaty aromas are forceful but not convincing. This feels choppy and raw on one hand, but sticky and chocolaty on the other. Herbal stewy currant and raw-wood flavors are challenging, while this tastes herbal and woody on the finish.
designation: Give Me Five by Javier Rodriguez

title: Pagos del Rey 2015 Blume Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Briny orange, grapefruit and grape-skin aromas announce an oily adequate palate. This has a gritty salty bitter-citrus flavor profile and a finish that's oddly nutty.

title: Eguren 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Generic plum and berry aromas are borderline volatile and include a forced note of chocolaty oak. This Tempranillo is abrupt and choppy on the palate, with flavors of candied plum and milk chocolate. A chocolaty oak character remains on a blocky finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Harry & David 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: Yeasty and dilute, this is a bit like drinking flat beer. There's little ripeness and no varietal impact.

title: Mollydooker NV Miss Molly Sparkling (McLaren Vale)
description: Call me traditional, but 100% American oak (roughly one-third new) doesn't quite harmonize with sparkling Shiraz, at least in this instance. It's given a sappy, resiny, almost hoppy character that lingers on the palate, marrying uneasily with the black cherry fruit.

title: Zoetic Wines 2014 Grazioso Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat flat and sweetly tropical, aged for six months in both neutral French oak and stainless steel. With 5% Viognier added to the blend, it lacks precision.

title: Lambert 2014 The Prologue Sparkling Pinot Noir-Chardonnay  (Barossa Valley)
description: This is appropriately light to medium in body, with a tart, crisp finish, but also shows some slightly Sherried aromas and tired fruit.

title: Veramar NV Riesling-Vidal Blanc White (Virginia)
description: On the nose, this wine offers muted banana, lychee and pineapple. Flavors are tropical and overripe, coating the mouth with plump papaya, passion fruit and guava. It's a little heavy, needing a bit more acidic lift.

title: Narmada 2015 Virginia Mom White (Virginia)
description: Intense aromas of peach and lemon-lime are softened by notes of concrete and flint. On the palate, there is a muskiness that is eventually overpowered by guava, peach and sour apple, finishing tart.

title: Matarromera 2015 Granza Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Sharp, punchy aromas of citrus, green herbs and celery lead to a tight drawing palate. This tastes feline, bitter and a bit like passion fruit. Pyrazine-based green flavors of thyme and scallion drive the finish.

title: Eguren 2015 Selección Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Slightly volatile plum and currant aromas are pointy and suggest vinegar. This feels acidic, raw and bumpy, while herbal plum and salty currant flavors finish with tartaric sizzle and residual saltiness.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Moorooduc 2011 Robinson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mornington Peninsula)
description: What a big difference a year can make on the Mornington Peninsula, which juts daringly out into the Southern Ocean near Melbourne. This is lightweight and tart, revealing hints of decaying leaves, fruit reminiscent of pie cherries and virtually no tannin.

title: Harry & David 2014 Ross Lane Red (Southern Oregon)
description: Among the components are Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec, with one-quarter of the blend listed simply as “more.” It's dark in hue and light in flavor, with thin citrus flavors dominating.

title: Trump 2015 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Monticello)
description: Bursting with fruity aromas of peaches, peach ring candies and orange blossom, this is a fresh wine. Juicy mango and more peach unfold on the palate. The feel is thin and isn't able to compete with the intense flavors and aromas, while the finish is tart and saccharine.

title: Harry & David 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Southern Oregon)
description: This looks dark and has the listed alcohol to suggest a wine with some muscle, but it's not in the glass. It's tannic, herbal, astringent and quick to the finish line.

title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Wine Wings Moscatel-Garnacha White (Cariñena)
description: Tropical aromas of lychee are about all that stand out on the nose of this unusual Moscatel-Garnacha Blanca blend. Neither dry nor sweet, this seems caught in no man's land. A dilute mouthfeel and bitter pyrazine notes on the finish don't help this along.

title: James Charles 2015 Arrivato 1913 Ameritage Red (Virginia)
description: This wine is jammy and synthetic on the nose, with cherry, concord grape jelly and red Jell-o notes. More grape jelly flavors unfold on the palate, along with cherry pie. It's full bodied, but the tannins are harsh and the long finish is a touch warm.

title: Jaxon Keys 2014 Estate Grown Cecil Keys Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: This earthy wine has overripe fruit aromas and sweet apple flavors. It's medium-bodied and soft in texture.

title: Tangley Oaks 2014 Lot #25 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Despite a good track record producing California Pinot Noir, Tangley Oaks' foray north into the Willamette Valley does not impress. It tastes and smells of mushroom compost, with no hint of any definitive fruit, no suggestion of varietal character. Two bottles tasted, same results.

title: Harry & David 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Oregon)
description: Extremely pale in color and dilute in flavor, this might be reminiscent of watermelon, and could go down easily on a warm day. But there's not much here in the way of actual flavor.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Bangsund Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Sometimes high-toned volatile wines can benefit from the added lift to the nose and the fruit, but here it's a bit out of hand. The volatility carries into the flavors, brightening the tart fruit but tasting too close to nail polish in the finish.

title: Beresford 2013 Single Vineyard Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
description: Let me confess upfront: creamed corn was one of my favorite side dishes when I was a child. That said, it's not something I like in my wine, and this medium-bodied Chardonnay shows an excess of those sweet corn and lactic aromas and flavors.
